data.title: Five Minutes With An Angel
data.meta_description: We grab busy new Victoria's Secret Angel Lais Ribeiro to talk motherhood, modelling and devastating fashion injuries
data.text:
You became an Angel this year (congratulations!) - how did that

feel? Where were you when you found out and how did you react?

What's the best thing about being an Angel?

I was so excited that I cried! Tears of happiness, of course. I was shooting an editorial in Mexico and the team thought something bad had happened when they saw me crying… It was the opposite! I'm still pinching myself. The best part of all is being able to have an even deeper connection with my VS family.

Read more: Lais Ribeiro: Catwalk CV

You used to do a lot of catwalk, but have

scaled back in recent years and are doing much more editorial - why

is that? Is it a conscious decision?

Walking in shows is so great. It's such a privilege to be the first to see each designer's collection before the editors and the public. I enjoy it all… shows, advertising, editorial - but there's only one of me so I can't be in two places at one time.

Your seven-year-old son Alexandre must be

beginning to understand more clearly what you do for a living. Do

you talk to him about your job?

He actually doesn't really know what I do. When my Self story came out, he saw the pictures and asked if it was me… I said it was me and that it's my job and he replied, 'What? Are you famous or something?'

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

Many models who have become mothers while

young - Jourdan Dunn for example - have talked about how much more

it motivates them to achieve and succeed in their career. Has that

been the same for you? What else has it changed?

Having a child changes everything, obviously. Yes, it's motivated me more to be the best person I can be and to be a true role model for him.

Have you spent much time with the other

Angels since you were all confirmed? Are there friends of yours

among the group?

I've been shooting for VS for quite some time so over the years, I've built deep friendships with a love of the most recent Angels. I've always looked up to Adriana and Alessandra. I've also become very close to Behati, Candice and Jac because we've spent the most time together.

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

There are lots of Brazilians among the VS

group - seven including you in the last show - is it nice to have

your fellow Brazilians around you? What do they understand about

you that other nationalities might not?

Brazilians share a love for great food. Besides a common language, Adriana, Isabeli, and Alessandra and I share a bond as mothers.

You are the only model who has ever been

confirmed for a VS show and then pulled out on the day due to

injury - how did you feel that day?

That was a devastating experience, but I was so honoured to be included in the video the following year. I was touched by how kindly my VS family handled it and honoured that I was featured in such a beautiful manner.

What do you like to do when you're not at work? Where are you

based most of the time?

I'm based in NYC but travel all over the world. I'm never in the same place each week! When I'm not working, I usually spend most of my time with my son.

If you could talk to your 10-year-old self

what would you tell her? Did she think she'd be a full-time model

one day?

If I could talk to my 10-year-old self I would tell her to love herself, and keep up the hard work. My focus at the time was on school, my dream was to study medicine. I have been so blessed.

What's the best lesson you've learned from working in the

fashion industry?

The best lesson I have learned is to never underestimate myself.

Read more: Victoria's Secret Angels In Vogue

Lais Ribeiro is the face of Bottletop, for more information on the brand and its aims visit Bottletop.org
